Articles.Content:
[CENTER][SIZE=5][FONT=arial black][COLOR=#333333]TO BE UPDATED FURTHER
________________________________________________________________[/COLOR][/FONT][/SIZE][/CENTER]
[COLOR=#333333][FONT=verdana][SIZE=2]
Welcome! This thread is where I host all my craft, complete with stats, albums, and downloads. I specialize in replicas, past, present, and future, of all kinds of craft. I'll also have a completely original idea from time to time too, so don't worry. Everything here will always be stock, and unless specifically stated will be compatible with the current game version. Happy browsing, and happy landings!

[CENTER]
[/CENTER]

[B][I][SIZE=3][FONT=arial black]SECTIONS:[/FONT]
[/SIZE][/I][/B]
LAUNCHERS: Energia, Falcon 9, Falcon Heavy, SLS/Orion, Ares 1

SPACECRAFT: Dragon 2, Soyuz, Skylab, Pisces/Taurus Landers, Starship Enterprise, Copernicus MTV, ATV

PROBES: Cassini/Huygens, Phoenix, Voyager 1, Rosetta/Philae[/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR][COLOR=#333333][FONT=verdana], Hubble, JWST

[/FONT][/COLOR][COLOR=#333333][FONT=verdana][SIZE=2][SIZE=2]WIP CRAFT: Dragon 2 rebuild, BA-330, ARM/Orion, Copernicus MTV rebuild



[B][FONT=arial black][I][SIZE=3]LAUNCHERS:[/SIZE][/I][/FONT]


[/B]
[FONT=arial black][B][I]Energia[/I][/B][/FONT] was one of the largest rockets to have ever flown, and also one of the most obscure. Built by the Soviet Union, it made only two flights before being discarded. It lives on, however, in KSP!

[/SIZE][/SIZE][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/lafq95f.png[/IMG]

[URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117154-Zucal-s-Stock-Storehouse#"][B][Spoiler: Energia Details][/B][/URL]



The [FONT=arial black][B][I]Falcon 9[/I][/B][/FONT], developed by SpaceX, is a rising star of the aerospace world as SpaceX attempts to use it to perfect reuseability, potentially changing the face of commercial space forever. Beware! It's a bit wobbly, so mind your ascent. Launch vehicle of choice for the Dragon v2.

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/3h9wtmA.png[/IMG]

[URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117154-Zucal-s-Stock-Storehouse#"][B][Spoiler: Falcon 9 Details][/B][/URL]



The [FONT=arial black][B][I]Falcon Heavy[/I][/B][/FONT] is the next launch vehicle due to come from SpaceX, set to fly for the first time this year. It will be the most powerful rocket to fly since Energia and the Saturn V! Major props to Mad Rocket Scientist for helping me test this. If you're reading this, you're a lifesaver.

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/zc3tlb5.png[/IMG]

[URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117154-Zucal-s-Stock-Storehouse#"][B][Spoiler: Falcon Heavy Details][/B][/URL]



The [FONT=arial black][B][I]Space Launch System[/I][/B][/FONT], due to make its maiden flight with Orion in 2018, will be the most powerful rocket since the Saturn V and will mark humanity's first step towards Mars. You can have it sooner than that though, with this stunning replica. Props to MRS for the inspiration for the boosters.

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/3hPMXL3.png[/IMG]

[URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117154-Zucal-s-Stock-Storehouse#"][B][Spoiler: SLS/Orion Details][/B][/URL]



The [FONT=arial black][I][B]Ares 1[/B][/I][/FONT] was part of the now-canceled Constellation Program, the launch vehicle for the Orion crew capsule.

[/FONT][/COLOR][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/eA76B4C.png[/IMG][COLOR=#333333][FONT=verdana]

[URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117154-Zucal-s-Stock-Storehouse#"][B][Spoiler: Ares 1 Details][/B][/URL]



[B][FONT=arial black][SIZE=3][I]SPACECRAFT:[/I][/SIZE][/FONT]
[/B]


The [FONT=arial black][I][B]Dragon v2[/B][/I][/FONT], launched upon the Falcon 9, will truly be a 21st century spacecraft. Instead of parachutes, it will use a novel propulsive landing system. That's just one of many features the KSP version shares!

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/o2dq5d8.png[/IMG]

[URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117154-Zucal-s-Stock-Storehouse#"][B][Spoiler: Dragon v2 Details][/B][/URL]



The [FONT=arial black][B][I]Soyuz[/I][/B][/FONT] spacecraft has been in service in various forms for decades. This reliable Russian craft comes to life ingame, launcher not included.

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/MONMawU.png[/IMG]

[URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117154-Zucal-s-Stock-Storehouse#"][B][Spoiler: Soyuz Details][/B][/URL]



[FONT=arial black][B][I]Skylab[/I][/B][/FONT] was the first true American space station. Visited by a number of crews, three of them would have added up to the same habitable volume as the entire International Space Station! If you can figure out how to get this up to orbit in 1.0, have fun. Launcher not included.

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/Eus44Md.png[/IMG]

[URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117154-Zucal-s-Stock-Storehouse#"][B][Spoiler: Skylab Details][/B][/URL]



An original craft, the [FONT=arial black][B][I]Pisces and Taurus[/I][/B][/FONT] Altair-style landers are vastly overbuilt, both in the engineering and the looks departments. The ascent stage of the Taurus lander is a duplicate of the Pisces lander, so both craft come in one download. The craft details are for the Taurus lander, not the Pisces.

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/M1Kk22u.png[/IMG]

[URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117154-Zucal-s-Stock-Storehouse#"][B][Spoiler: Pisces/Taurus Details][/B][/URL]

[COLOR=#333333]

The [FONT=arial black][I][B]Starship Enterprise[/B][/I][/FONT] filled the minds of kids everywhere with scifi wonders. Hopefully this quick recreation does the same!

[/COLOR][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/m7EltV1.png[/IMG][COLOR=#333333]
[/COLOR]
[URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117154-Zucal-s-Stock-Storehouse#"][B][Spoiler: Enterprise Details][/B][/URL]


Ã¢â‚¬â€¹
[/FONT][/COLOR][COLOR=#333333][COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana]The Copernicus MTV was to form a key part of the Constellation Program, the link between LEO and Mars. Designed to house astronauts on the way to Mars and back, it was truly an impressive feat of almost-built engineering. [/FONT][/COLOR][/COLOR][SIZE=1][COLOR=#333333][COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana]I cri evrytiem. [/FONT][/COLOR][/COLOR][/SIZE][SIZE=2][COLOR=#333333][COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana]Copernicus may never exist in the real world, but you can have it sitting in LKO as soon as you want! (Provided you find a way to get it up there.) Hopefully this replica does it justice.
[/FONT][/COLOR][/COLOR][/SIZE][COLOR=#333333][FONT=verdana][B][FONT=arial black][SIZE=3][I][FONT=verdana][SIZE=2]
[/SIZE][/FONT][/I][/SIZE][/FONT][/B][/FONT][/COLOR][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/vPfCEHX.png[/IMG][COLOR=#333333][FONT=verdana][FONT=arial black][SIZE=3][FONT=verdana][SIZE=2]
[/SIZE]
[SIZE=2][URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117154-Zucal-s-Stock-Storehouse#"][B][Spoiler: Copernicus MTV Details][/B][/URL] [/SIZE]

[SIZE=2]

[/SIZE][/FONT][/SIZE][/FONT][/FONT][/COLOR][COLOR=#333333][COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana][FONT=verdana]The ATV was one of the most flexible spacecraft ever made. Produced by the ESA and launched aboard the Ariane 5, the ATV was a cargo spacecraft for the International Space Station. The last one departed and burned up in the atmosphere several months ago, but it lives on in the form of the Orion [SIZE=2]spacecraft's service module. Feast yer' eyes![/SIZE][/FONT][SIZE=2]
[/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR][/COLOR][COLOR=#333333][FONT=verdana][FONT=arial black][SIZE=3][SIZE=2]
[/SIZE][/SIZE][/FONT][/FONT][/COLOR][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/94UNeo9.png[/IMG][COLOR=#333333][FONT=verdana][FONT=arial black][SIZE=3][SIZE=2]

[FONT=verdana]Ã¢â‚¬â€¹ [URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117154-Zucal-s-Stock-Storehouse#"][B][Spoiler: ATV Details][/B][/URL]
[/FONT]


[/SIZE][B][I]PROBES:[/I][/B][/SIZE][/FONT]



[FONT=arial black][I]Cassini/Huygens[/I][/FONT] arrived at Saturn a few years ago, and has provided beautiful pictures of the planet, the rings, and the moons. This KSP replica is almost as beautiful as the planet itself! In the meantime, the Huygens lander touched down on the moon Titan.

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/pLTiC8I.png?1[/IMG]

[URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117154-Zucal-s-Stock-Storehouse#"][B][Spoiler: Cassini/Huygens Details][/B][/URL]



The [FONT=arial black][B][I]Phoenix Mars Lander[/I][/B][/FONT] was one of NASA's early attempts to find life and water on the Red Planet.

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/linzaSM.png[/IMG]

[URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117154-Zucal-s-Stock-Storehouse#"][B][Spoiler: Phoenix Details][/B][/URL]



[FONT=arial black][B][I]Voyager 1[/I][/B][/FONT] became the first craft to exit the solar system and enter interstellar space a few years ago, after concluding its Grand Tour of the planets.

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/jGEEN39.png[/IMG]

[URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117154-Zucal-s-Stock-Storehouse#"][B][Spoiler: Voyager Details][/B][/URL]



[COLOR=#333333]I was bored and felt like doing some low-g somersaults, so I went and built this quick n' dirty Rosetta mission recreation, using Gilly as the stand-in comet. [FONT=arial black][B][I]Rosetta and Philae[/I][/B][/FONT] are two spacecraft currently investigating the comet Churyumov-Gerasimenko. Rosetta is the orbiter, while a few months ago Philae became the first spacecraft to land on a comet.
[/COLOR]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/3hYRmET.png[/IMG]

[URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117154-Zucal-s-Stock-Storehouse#"][B][Spoiler: Rosetta/Philae Details][/B][/URL]



The [FONT=arial black][B][I]Hubble Space Telescope[/I][/B][/FONT] has been in service for 25 years now, and provided a vast wealth of images and science related to the universe. Just as it expanded our knowledge of the universe, this will expand your knowledge of the unlimited building creativity stock offers!

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/XbBzWnk.png[/IMG]

[URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117154-Zucal-s-Stock-Storehouse#"][B][Spoiler: Hubble Details][/B][/URL]



[SIZE=2]The [FONT=arial black][B][I]James Webb Space Telescope[/I][/B][/FONT], or JWST, is one of the funkiest spacecraft designs known to man. [COLOR=#333333]I think it says something about me that the first thing I thought when I saw the Hex resource scanner was: "What happens when it's spinning and it hits a Kerbal?" The second thing I thought was "I could build a telescope using that." And here it is! Due for launch in 2018, JWST will be the next Hubble, taking our knowledge of the early days of the universe further than ever before. They said it couldn't be built in KSP! And... well, they were right. Until now, at least![/COLOR][/SIZE]

[/FONT][/COLOR][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/Hy4WI8S.png[/IMG][COLOR=#333333][FONT=verdana]
[SIZE=2]
[/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR][COLOR=#333333][URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117154-Zucal-s-Stock-Storehouse#"][B][Spoiler: JWST Details][/B][/URL] [/COLOR][COLOR=#333333][FONT=verdana][SIZE=2]



Thanks for viewing![/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR]
